tags: Value for money,
review:
I would like to tell, the doctor will write the name of the medicines which you'll never find on any other pharmacy, except him, and that is pathetic ******* **** ********** ** * ******* *** *** *** * ******** ****** *** even googling the names won't give you similar searches because you don't know the salt in it, rather than writing the particular name kindly please the salt or any name through which a person can easily find the medicine anywhere, his two assistants will themself tell you that you won't find the medicines anywhere in the market.
I know the market of this industry because my father is a pharmacist.
It's a humble request kindly write the names of the medicines which are readily availablle ****** **** ****** **** *** ******
reply_text:
Dear Mr. Rathore,
We will be updating soon, with digital prescriptions where the name of the drugs will be mentioned with the brand names.
Thank you and best of luck
Regards
Dr. Madhur Mahna

tags: None
review:
Highly expensive and pathetic experience ever! I don't have any feedback for doctor as it was my first visit but my experience was not good at all. First, the clinic charged me some 1400 rs for both hands xray which is way more than the usual charge for these scans and secondly as usual, the doctor prescribed the medicines which are super hard to find and expensive too.

Pathetic experience. Even the staff was so untidy and  unprofessional, they just told me that this is the fees for these scans. I think they should have a rate card or lost to justify their over the top charges or they should atleast inform about the charges to the patient.

Worst experience ever at any orthopedic clinic !

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I have visited Dr.Madhur Mahna's clinic a month ago with a problem of lower backache. A thing which quiet impressed me is that he listens to you attentively & completely & then suggests you the best. He gives the proper time to the patient until he/she gets fully satisfied. Also all the services like medicines,investigations,physiothreaphy,X-ray etc are available under one roof. Overall, a complete setup at one place. Also services has a good pace. Also the staff is very good & helpful. Lastly, I got relief from the treatment he has given to me within short span. Thanks Dr.Madhur Mahna

tags: Wait time,
context: Hip Pain Treatment,Joint and Muscle Problems,
review: I’m a Brain stroke patient and post my stroke have been suffering from severe Shoulder and Hip joints’ pain. This was not only causing me extreme discomfort but also stopped me from my physiotherapy. I visited Dr Madhur twice and his treatment has completely resolved my issues. I’m totally pain free in both joints and his advice on physio and general lifestyle helped me continue my physio again. I would recommend Dr Madhur to anyone, mainly because of his precision in diagnosis and treatment that ensures very quick recovery.
reply_text:
Dear Mr. Jolly,
Thank you for the wonderful feedback.
Hope you're feeling much better now.
Regards
Dr. Madhur Mahna

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Orthopedic Physiotherapy,Congenital Disorders Evaluation / Treatment,Joint and Muscle Problems,
review: Dr. Madhur is a highly proficient doctor with excellent surgical and patient care skills. I have been regularly visiting him and taking consultation for my mother in law's  joint problems and we are extremely satisfied with his advice regarding medication, physiotherapy and home exercises. My mother in-law has shown significant improvement in symptoms (pain, difficulty in walking and frequent lower back aches) due to age related osteoarthiritis of both the knee joints. I highly recommend this doctor for joints and spine related problems.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I had pain in my knees
On xray, the doc told me that its early arthritis 
He advised me a Prp
Although i was not ready earlier but he convinced me that its not a steroid injection
He gave me that injection in both knees
I started having relief 5-6 days after the injection
After 3 weeks my pain is almost gone
His centre has all facilities like xray and lab and physiotherapy 
Highly recommended

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,

He advised me to go for non surgical treatment
I did a month of physiotherapy at his centre and I'm completely pain free now
I recommend him to anyone who has orthopedic problem

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,

I visited the clinic because of extreme due to a twisted ankle.
Doctor thoroughly examined my foot amd recommend an X-Ray. It was much easier to get to X-ray room because of the stair lift which is bonus in case of any issues related to legs.

You also get the option to purchase your medication from the clinic only which is a plus point

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: He is a fantastic doctor and above all a wonderful human being. He empathizes with the patients and is concerned about their well being and respects their time and money. tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: I approached Dr Madhur Mahna with severe pain in my shoulder. He was all ears and listened to the problem very patiently. He immediately addressed the problem and asked to carry out only one or two necessary tests. He very humbly explained the line of treatment and started with it. I can very happily say that my decision to visit him was a good one as my shoulder pain is a thing of past now.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Very good doctor….. always taking care of all patient with best treatment…. Thanks doctor Madhur……….

tags: None
review:
The doctor will insist on an x-ray even if you had an x-ray done recently. Charges 700 for the x ray.
Then he will prescribe medicines which are only available at his clinic. NO pharmacy *** ******** *** ************* I was about to get charged around 2000 rupees for the medicine *** ******* * *** **** **** ******* ******* ******* ******* ***** i refused to buy the medicines.
So the 600 consultation *** ** **** * **** ** *** *** ***
The doctor will respond to this review and justify his low costs BUT as a reader, it is upto you to decide whether to go to him OR TO AVOID COMPLETELY.
reply_text:
1. Any standard Xray lab charges 850 for the same x-ray as yours. Discounts are available at every centre including ours.

2. Unlike medical conditions, drugs for Orthopedic treatment are relatively expensive, especially ones for treatment of joint problems. 
No patient can be forced to buy any medicines. 
It was your wish to not buy medicines, and no one from my staff tried to convince you to do otherwise, a point which should have been mentioned in your detailed review.

3. If any patient wants to buy a medicine from any other chemist, she/he is most welcome to do so. They are NEVER stopped, or convinced to buy the prescribed medicines from my clinic.
As i repeatedly say, me and my staff are more than happy to assist the patients, in case any problem arises while purchasing the medicines from a pharmacy.

4. By your assumption of how I will or won't reply to your review, it's very clear that for some reason you came with a pre-formed bias, as you never tried to approach me either for the cost of the medicines, or their availability at a pharmacy, something that any patient should do in case such a situation arises with a clinician.
Regardless of that sir, i wish you luck for your future 🙏🏻
Regards 
Dr. Madhur Mahna

tags: None
review: ************* ****** *** at the same time has high charges. Took Rs 700 for wrist xray which generally cost 400-500 max. Advised an injection having mrp as 300, he asked 3000 for the same. Better to avoid if u are looking for an economical doctor.
reply_text:
Respected Mr Chadha,
I'm sorry to see that your experience was not as per your expectations.
1. Average fee for an orthopedic surgeon in Delhi is ₹800. My fee is 600.

2. Two views of any part in any X-ray centre costs 800-900 rupees, except for special offers, or charitable clinics. 
While at my centre, which is NOT charitable, the X-ray for two views is 700, and we normally reduce the cost to 600.
Either way, any patient is free to get an xray or any other investigation from anywhere they feel like.

3. An intra-articular injection is an expert procedure which can be given only by a specialist. So the charges are not for consumables, but for the procedure. Just like when you consult a doctor, you are only exchanging words, which is basically air, which ais for free, but you still pay a fee for the knowledge, skill and the treatment prescribed by the doctor, regardless of whether she/he gives anything material in your hand, the price of which you can search on the internet.
🙏🏻

I hope I am made my point clear.
Hope you get well soon
Regards,
Dr. Madhur Mahna

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Not satisfied with the consultation as my queries were left unsolved. *** ********* **** ******* **** ******* *** I cannot comment on those as I didn’t complete the cycle.
reply_text:
Dear Mr. Kukreja,
I’m sorry that your experience was not as pleasant as you expected it to be.
I’m a little taken aback by your comment that your queries were left unsolved. Because You did not ask many questions about your problem in the first place, moreover you never reviewed with the investigations which were advised, so you left the treatment incomplete.
All my patients have total liberty to call me up whenever they have a query.
You also have the option of Practo Consult where a follow up question can be asked on the app itself, which you didnot use.
Whenever I prescribe a medicine I describe each one of them in detail to every patient. So there are never any secrets there.
Since you never got the investigations, and you yourself wrote that you didn’t take the medicines either, expecting a favourable result would be unfair.
Either way, I pray that your problem goes away
Thank you
Dr. Madhur Mahna

tags: Value for money,
review: Doctor has prescribed medicine which are not available at outside phamacies even at online pharmacy sites like netmeds, 1mg, medlife etc.  ******* ********** *** **** *** **** ** ********* *** ********* *** ***** ******
reply_text:
Dear Mr Agarwal,
It’s unfortunate that you had to face a problem in finding the medicines at some other pharmacy.
I have kept a medicine counter at the centre itself for the CONVENIENCE of the patient so that he/she can get everything at a single stop.

The fact that the pharmacies you went to didn’t recognise the medicines is a reflection of their lack of knowledge.

The only criteria I have of prescribing a medicine is its result.
If given a choice between prescribing a  ‘popular’ medicine which is easily available but has a sub optimal effect, and another medicine which might not be easily available but has better results, I will choose the latter one any day.

Moreover, internet apps never were, and never will be, my criteria of prescribing a medicine.
It will be a sad day for the medical profession if a random smart phone app gets to decide whether a qualified doctor, who has dedicated the prime of his life to studying medicine, is prescribing the correct drugs or not.

All of my patients have the liberty to buy medicines from anywhere they feel like, and to revert back to me if any medicine is unavailable. I would gladly explain the ingredients to the pharmacist so that they can provide an alternative.

Praying for your speedy recovery
Regards
Dr. Madhur Mahna

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
Value for money,
reply_text:
Respected Mr. Babbar,

1. I don't understand what did you mean when you mentioned that the staff was "making accords". The staff do their job as per the protocol issued by the treating doctor. All the services have fixed prices which were explained to you. No one forced any patient to take any services.
Kindly refrain using such language unbecoming a decent citizen.

2. No one at any clinic, especially mine, can be forced to give the patient anything. A particular treatment is prescribed and it's the patients choice to take the treatment or not. 
You were not advised any Vit D3 injection, and the patient who was given a Vit D3 injection in front of you, gave me a five star review on practo itself.
So kindly refrain from making such atrocious accusations and also refrain from giving opinions on behalf of other patients.

3. All the invoices are absolutely legal and follow all government guidelines for medical clinics. Sir Please don't comment on things you don't know about.

At our centre all practices are absolutely fair and legal, and they routinely go through government checks.

While respecting the opinion of every patient, it is also essential to clear out facts, and to answer fo such atrocious baseless accusations.

 I wish you all the best for the future.
🙏🏻
